intro: Eupyrena hexasperma, commonly known as the six-ridged grasshopper orchid, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and open forests, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white, with a unique structure that aids in pollination by specific insect species. Eupyrena hexasperma is a protected species due to habitat loss and is often found in coastal regions of southern Australia.
